patterns_discovered.structured_approach: 9-phase implementation plan with clear subtask breakdown
patterns_discovered.incremental_progress: Building baseline measurement before optimization phases
patterns_discovered.modular_design: Separate benchmark modules for different aspects (proxy, memory)
patterns_discovered.configuration_driven: CLI options and configurable parameters for benchmarks
patterns_discovered.documentation_integration: README.md and integration with package.json scripts
patterns_discovered.state_management: JSON-based progress tracking with task state persistence

gotchas_discovered.complexity_scaling: Implementation plan shows 27 subtasks across 9 phases - potential complexity explosion
gotchas_discovered.performance_targets: Ambitious <10ms latency target vs current industry standards (LiteLLM's 15-30ms)
gotchas_discovered.memory_constraints: Base memory target of <100MB is challenging for proxy applications
gotchas_discovered.dependency_management: No JSON parser performance evaluation mentioned - may need to benchmark multiple options
gotchas_discovered.integration_points: Many integration points between phases - potential for cascading failures

approach_outcome.methodology: Systematic benchmark-first approach with clear measurement baseline
approach_outcome.scope_definition: Well-defined scope through acceptance criteria for each subtask
approach_outcome.progress_tracking: Comprehensive progress tracking with JSON serialization
approach_outcome.risk_management: Fallback mechanisms specified (e.g., fetch fallback when pool exhausted)
approach_outcome.quality_assurance: Test suite included alongside benchmark implementation

recommendations: Performance baseline should be established before moving to optimization phases
Consider breaking down large subtasks (like connection pooling) into smaller iterations
Implement the profiling instrumentation (subtask 1.3) early to identify bottlenecks
Create performance budgets for each optimization phase
Add regression tests to ensure optimizations don't break existing functionality
Consider horizontal scaling strategies early in the design
Plan for A/B testing between current and optimized versions
